(Previous Paper: C.Pi.526(24)).I trust we shall not relinquish the practice of having a British Sirdar for the Egyptian Army, and of having British officers and instructors employed therein. It would be a great mistake for us to depart from well established custom in this "matter, and the demand of Egypt for European instructors of other nationalities could scarcely be resisted if we declined to help In the organisation of their forces.W.S.C.Treasury Chambers,S .
